summary: This is an email chain from July 4, 2008, between an FBI agent and an Assistant U.S. Attorney discussing the Epstein investigation. It references unidentified names in message pads, potential other victims, and includes a forwarded message from attorney Ted Leopold providing client names.

persons.name: Ted Leopold
persons.context: He sends an email to the Assistant U.S. Attorney providing the names of his two clients in relation to the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Spencer Kuvin
persons.context: He is copied on Ted Leopold's email to the Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding the Epstein investigation.

connections.description: Ted Leopold copies Spencer Kuvin on an email to the Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding the Epstein investigation, indicating a professional legal association.

events.title: Email discussion on Epstein investigation
events.description: An FBI agent and an Assistant U.S. Attorney exchange emails on July 4th, discussing unidentified names in message pads and the expectation of hearing from more victims following Epstein's conviction.

events.title: Attorney provides client names
events.description: Attorney Ted Leopold emails the Assistant U.S. Attorney with the names of his two clients related to the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The document indicates there were unidentified names, believed to be girls, in message pads related to the Epstein investigation.
The FBI agent expresses a belief that more victims would come forward following Epstein's conviction.
Attorney Ted Leopold provided the names of two clients to the Assistant U.S. Attorney in connection with the investigation.
The correspondence shows ongoing communication between law enforcement and legal counsel regarding the Epstein case in mid-2008.
